results.title: The Renaissance & the new world
results.creator_credit: Metropolitan Museum of Art (New York, N.Y.) and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 26 of Series “The Western tradition”.
During the 15th and 16th Centuries, the Europeans were confronted by the discovery of new societies which challenged their understanding of the world and provoked a revolution in critical thinking. Prof. Eugen Weber asks,”What motivated the great explorers of the Renaissance, and how did their attitudes differ from a medieval mentality?” The New World was perceived as an earthly paradise and its people mythologised as “noble savages”. The importance of religion is explored, and how Christianity provided a rationale for slavery. Using Leonardo Da Vinci as a case study, Weber stresses the significance a new critical and comparative way of thinking, where knowledge was subject to revision on the basis of experience and observation.

results.title: The American republic
results.creator_credit: Art Cohen, Metropolitan Museum of Art and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Western tradition”.
This absorbing series is a survey of 2,000 years of Western civilisation illustrated by paintings, sculpture and other records from the past, compiled by the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Historian Eugen Weber analyses the American Republic which was comprised of radicals and conservatives and founded on the premises of “Universal Freedoms” for its inhabitants.

results.title: The American revolution
results.creator_credit: Carol Greenwald, Metropolitan Museum of Art and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Western tradition”.
This absorbing series is a survey of 2,000 years of Western civilisation illustrated by paintings, sculpture and other records from the past, compiled by the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Historian Eugen Weber looks at the American revolution and how British colonists created a society that tested Enlightenment ideas and resisted restrictions imposed by England.

results.title: Koalas
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian wildlife”.
The Koala’s popular image is as a sleepy, little creature. This film captures him in a more frolicsome mood - running, swimming and climbing. Active or drowsy, however, the Koala is always a popular subject. Also attmpts to correct some of the misconceptions about koalas.

results.title: Here's Humphrey
results.brief_description: Humphrey B. Bear has delighted Australian children for many years. Join Humphrey in a series of adventures filled with fun and excitement.

results.title: Humphrey in the snow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Here’s Humphrey”.
Join Humphrey on his first visit to the snow where he learns to ski, goes for a ride on a skiddoo, makes a model reindeer with Jodie and plays with snowballs. Humphrey in the snow will delight young children as it is a program filled with fun, games and excitement.

results.title: Six of the best
results.brief_description: This series looks at issues which affect young adults in their daily life. Six teenagers, Brian, Antoni, Carl, Paula, Sally and Theresa deal with such problems as employment, school and relationships. Passing out, Early starters, Pay day, Pairing off, Shooting through, and Knockbacks.
